quagga.predicted.text: the format looks good to me.  I'd suggest that you prepare the talking points
for Jeff and schedule some time to brief him in advance.  I got a response
from ted on Fri to the voicemail i left for him.  It sounded like he fully
understood your role and would take the appropriate steps with respect to the
recruiters.  Is it straightened out now?
Lisa Connolly
To: Jeff Skilling/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Steven J Kean/NA/Enron@Enron
cc: Sherri Sera/Corp/Enron@ENRON, Katherine Brown/Corp/Enron@ENRON,
Katherine Brown/Corp/Enron@ENRON
Subject: News Conference Layout
Scheduled for Febr. 1 at 2pm.
Location - at a fire station in a Hispanic Community - exact location will be
forwarded shortly but estimated distance from ENE office = less than 15 min.
Expect News Conference to last a total of 30 minutes, including Q&A. Jeff
Skilling will be spokesperson for Selection Committee. However, we will try
to have as many committee members present as possible.
Mayor will likely discuss (estimated time = 10 min.):
- changes that are required at HFD - potential need to bring in an outsider,
etc...
- reasoning behind involvement of Enron/Jeff Skilling & formation of
selection committee - de-politicize the process, etc...
JS should speak about the following (estimated time = 10-15 min.):
- how he became involved in the process
- how the committee members were selected
- who the members are with a brief background on each (We plan to provide a
bio on each of the committee members as part of the press release)
- time line for Fire Chief selection
Q&A (estimated time = 5-10 min.)
- expect questions along the lines of: Are the meetings going to be open or
closed?, Outsider vs. Insider related questions...
Please let me know if you have any questions/comments/issues with the above.
I'll coordinate collection of Bios from Committee members. Anything else I
can do to help out here?
Lisa
